section.title: Dough
section.instruction: In a sauce pan, melt the Butter.
Add Buttermilk and heat until luke warm.
Pour into large mixing bowl, and add Yeast.
Let sit until Yeast begins to foam. (about 3 minutes)
Add in Baking Soda, Sugar and Salt, and mix well.
Mix in Flour, one cup at a time, until dough is not sticky
Knead Dough for 10 minutes, adding more flour if dough is sticky.
Put into buttered bowl, and turn once so entire ball of dough is buttered.
Cover, and let rise until Dough doubles in size (about 45 minutes).

section.title: Filling
section.instruction: While dough is rising, combine all Filling Ingredients into a bowl.
Mix until smooth.

section.title: Assembling
section.instruction: Punch dough down and divide into thirds.
Roll each third out into a 9&inch; &by; 12&inch; rectangle.
Spread filling evenly across dough making sure it goes all the way to the edges.
Using a pizza cutter, cut the long way into 6 strips, each one about 1½&inch; wide and 12&inch; long.
Roll each strip up into a disk, and place, on its side, into a greased Texas Muffin Tin.
Let rise about 30 minutes.

section.title: Glaze
section.instruction: While Orange Rolls are rising, combine all Glaze Ingredients into a bowl.
Mix until smooth.

section.title: Finishing
section.instruction: Preheat Oven to 350°.

Bake at 350° for 14-16 minutes until golden brown.
Be very careful to not over cook!
Brush Glaze on while Orange Rolls are still hot.
Let Orange Rolls cool about 15 minutes, then gently remove.
